document.title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards English Language Arts (NJSLS-ELA)

313D9626059D43379538EB8E9C99AF41.description:
Speak in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide
requested detail or clarification.

1F9085E7BC304F07B34B6050D99B8EA9.description:
Use multimedia to demonstrate fluid reading at an understandable pace; add visual displays
when appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or details

3F516B49A19A4B0FBE0282D2050C6628.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and
relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace

768CE9EA025C4649828D596CED0A46BF.description:
Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration
and detail.

35BEDF10C9844CA5889684397D36BB88.description:
Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented
in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

DDE10964A5B6499F9FAF11F4A7B25794.description: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

F8B6CC5AE5904F5A8299838E27CACE03.description:
Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their
comments to the remarks of others.

FAC831DC4D9143C6B2E4A6189E09A934.description:
Follow agreed-upon norms for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening
to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

B9D69C226E8B4BAEBFFB884CF38BC3A9.description:
Explicitly draw on previously read text or material and other information known about the
topic to explore ideas under discussion.

9EAB760B115E422FB9A58CD38C6E1191.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher
led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own
clearly.

F6100E9CB0844FB6B25722D60F99A2D3.description:
Engage in independent and task-based writing for both short and extended periods of time,
producing written work routinely.

163EF7DCBD2A4AB6BD57B261A79EC81C.description:
Use discussion, books, or media resources to gather ideas, outline them, and prioritize the
information to include while planning to write about a topic.

1EE3E34E2C3B4A478C7BA775D47A8CE0.description:
Generate questions about a topic and independently locate related information from at least
two reference sources (print and non-print) to obtain information on that topic.

48A2806ADBE840FBAEF3696AA8C2C440.description:
With adult and peer feedback, and digital or print tools such as a dictionary, thesaurus,
and/or spell checker, find and correct errors and improve word choice.

A40C1F448C304A3489E1DE70EAC6D6D7.description: Consider writing as a process, including self-evaluation, revision and editing.

2BD7FBF5263C4E4C8D6DABF3C89A8D88.description: Identify audience, purpose, and intended length of composition before writing.

DC2FE4F34B3443A99D49E080B6839BE4.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed
by planning, revising, and editing.

60F53BD9AE8747F2B4D197F4FF1CC865.description: Provide a conclusion or sense of closure that follows the narrated experiences or events.

0440FAFE950E4B71B5864C115AAA51A2.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events.

3EB4D5E714994BD88089FC6B9AFBFB98.description: Use transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.

E9ECF66E97BE490EBF863CAC61D059BF.description:
Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of
characters to situations.

807F02B1D1DA474EA4166B46CCDB559E.description:
Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters;
clearly organize an event sequence.

C7C19D982DAE4FFA9F788387C6433097.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events with basic story elements.

8BA509400E0F4FB397084DD4319A7F0D.description: Provide a conclusion related to the information or explanation presented.

2CB592C04FDC43A2941FCCB2643399D8.description:
Link ideas within sections of information using transition words and phrases (e.g., then,
because, also, another, therefore).

43DFDBB3F03448E792EFDC8A783A6FA5.description:
Include text features (e.g.: illustrations, diagrams, captions) when useful to support
comprehension.

99AF4F48D5DF444DBFDFCA3C25A80793.description:
Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and concrete details, text evidence, or other
information and examples related to the topic.

9BF3E325F0144F22B5A301753FE7B9E1.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information
clearly.

CB6F5BC3737E4FC990D9AA0ED147A633.description: Provide a conclusion related to the opinion presented.

879ABDFDEBBD4DACB6850F6261C14E18.description:
Link ideas within sections of information using transition words and phrases (e.g., then,
because, also, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion and reasons.

EA80628F607445A1AEFD51B7019D4878.description:
Support the opinion with facts, definitions, reasons text evidence, or other information and
examples related to the topic.

6FA89F981225422B8EFD1245547B26CE.description: Write opinion texts to present an idea with reasons and information.

DB9DBBDDE13644CC9392C7124EF2C707.description:
Compare and contrast the elements of informational texts regarding the most important points
and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

417EFBAEC7DC487B9995B5CE2D4EADDF.description:
Compare and contrast the elements (theme, settings, and plots) of literary texts written by the
same author about similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).

6531F594B1104A0B9E882DD7AEC5F650.description:
Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g.,
comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence) to support specific points the author makes
in a text.

16B12294724D469DBE5537577B765EC9.description:
Use information gained from text features (e.g., illustrations, maps, photographs) and the
words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events
occur).

FF45CE48D0354A44BD4F8DA71C7F46E2.description:
Explain how specific aspects of a text’s illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the
words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).

AFA14941F9B84F339809C0DCE92D61E3.description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the author of a text.

604A6B914B764F79A7E46EF1326C3DC7.description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

A4EDE952B86B441991A05DB127963BDE.description:
Utilize and reference features of a text when writing or speaking about a text, using text
features (e.g., graphics, images, captions, headings) and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars,
hyperlinks) to locate and integrate information relevant to a given topic efficiently. '

9598F2154D434108A3DCC132F83A04F5.description:
Utilize and reference features of a text when writing or speaking about a text, referring to
parts of stories, dramas, and poems, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each
successive part builds on earlier sections.

1A252A11A17C405ABD57155B178B3B2C.description:
Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or
steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

9E9BD1A213794B29835804B67817674A.description:
Describe the development of individual character’s traits, motivations, or feelings and explain
how their actions contribute to the plot within a text.

77866CAB9920466BA34E25334DD9D9FC.description:
Recount in oral and written form the key details from a multi-paragraph informational text and
explain how they support the main idea.

7F8D2BAA369545BDA1D8E746F60FD2EA.description:
Recount in oral and written form key details from a text and explain how they support the
theme (in literary texts, e.g., fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures).

6C28654688C3460288ECD0CA9BE2BBA3.description:
Ask and answer questions and make relevant connections to demonstrate understanding of an
informational text, referring explicitly to textual evidence as the basis for the answers.

02198B92A2DC4A39AF68AA7AA7E25C35.description:
Ask and answer questions and make relevant connections to demonstrate understanding of a
literary text, referring explicitly to textual evidence as the basis for the answers.

C107D64374F347FEB8D16B7506935064.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees
of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

617EBBDD8CEF4832AFB9CAB6DCE61344.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people who are
friendly or helpful).

35E541C598C3483EAE66A89E620955C7.description:
Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take
steps).

B90F268139C84DA59EC7E4355E9B40CC.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships and nuances in word
meanings.

F4D64AEFE6C242F786B707FF6666D56A.description:
Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the
precise meaning of key words and phrases.

F647A077C2D24EF598B655CD27403E81.description:
Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root
(e.g., company, companion).

96BF9C3ADE4D437F8F5931136BB9DFAF.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known
word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless,
heat/preheat).

BD2809A8E85446B6807C7E2AAAA03B07.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

80B236D042B14793AB9FD28EB8DA9335.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning academic and
domain-specific words and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range
of strategies.

0B9C9A830BB341D3B9C11C756BEEF3CE.description: Recognize and observe differences between the conventions of spoken and written English.

EB961C298B154931862DA32F55490347.description: Choose words and phrases for effect.

15242BA1136243BEA957DE00BEBB8C6E.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic, and
domain-specific words and phrases.

096A25B548814A76AC867EDF07C6F5EF.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

BC60464A79E24546BE505029218F91D4.description: Organize ideas into paragraphs with main ideas and supporting details.

D84852F3011A421485B5B3A69AC4F225.description: Paraphrase a main idea or event in order to vary sentence structure and word use.

28757873F2324BD98C17E7B427E9B6CD.description:
Combine simple sentences into compound sentences, using conjunctions and, but, or, yet,
and so.

E53D843B5EB640538325924AD0045040.description:
Use periods, question marks, exclamation points, commas, apostrophes, and quotation
marks appropriately. (e.g., commas and quotation marks in dialogue, and commas in
addresses).

52D8427115ED4FC484CA3E0D59032F60.description: Use appropriate pronouns with clear referents.

BC102D04B6BE4DC6A54AAC847032957E.description:
Use common regular and irregular plural forms, writing nouns and verbs that agree in
number.

CE1E58577AA9459BAA73C29DA0B0091F.description: Choose and maintain consistency of tense, writing nouns and verbs that agree in tense.

8089C8C452374EBE9155E18EC760D745.description:
Improve communication of meaning by replacing weak verbs with stronger ones, and
common nouns with precise nouns.

3119E28AD9CE48CBB1812FB7E9FF9A3F.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of writing including those listed under grade two
foundational skills.

339DD27EA7C0496F98F59E33487F0384.description: Spell common words in English, including regular and irregular forms.

1683422DFE3B477B9B17896F01192B45.description:
Spell regular two- and three-syllable words that:i. Combine all basic syllable types: closed, VCe, open, vowel team, vowel –r,
Consonant-le.
ii. Include common, transparent, prefixes and suffixes (e.g., re-, pre-, sub-, un-,
dis-, mis-; -able, -ness, -ful) and suffix -tion.

0E62BB8C27454FD180AF1C63EED1EEA6.description: Change y to i (cried) in words with suffixes, when required

9B56BC8B47DE49B9A413579D9F99A9E3.description: Spell singular and plural possessives (teacher’s; teachers’)

E5091F5AE03C4A88B64FE45A97FD1D11.description: Identify language of word origin, as noted in dictionaries.

AF914020CFDD4864AEE943B054FBAB3C.description:
Use digital or print tools such as a dictionary or thesaurus to check spellings of unknown
words.

4D03CC6B59E844A79565F5B50F126BD0.description:
Spell single syllable words with less common and complex graphemes (ough, augh; -old, -ind,
-ost, -ild families).

098DC14E634F4251886494B7E5A7E2FF.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of encoding and spelling.

16B1B97E5B01429588D035F1FA9BEA8E.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

49A718A737A74A119AA6C0AA60D3BA62.description: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

53587CCB9B51409FBED31C01A2499D47.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

9214CBE867A840129AA746B22DF3C9A2.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

3A8BA723F7EA4FF3A2D09EA25C17AC74.description: Analyze the parts of high-frequency words that are regular and the parts that are irregular.

A956FE168D3644B1AB8CBF2014297685.description: Decode words with common Latin suffixes.

BA88C959B111442E8785187942F09AE7.description: Identify and know the meaning of the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes.

4BEE4611D847480497BBFADB5FDF7BA1.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding and encoding words.
